text: there are dozens of recipes for baked
marinated chicken out there but this
one's a little different it uses Middle
Eastern flavors and then I also add
vegetables so when you bake it up you've
got a complete meal if you can make the
marinade the day before you really
should because the longer the chicken
sits in it up to 24 hours the more
flavorful it's gonna be and there are
two reasons for that
one you have the salt and so you're
gonna get this evenly flavored chicken
and you also have the acid in the lemon
juice and in the orange juice and then
that helps tenderize the chicken for
this recipe I'm gonna heat up all the
marinade ingredients and that way it
starts to condense before they even meet
the chicken makes it even more flavorful
so I've got lemon juice freshly squeezed
of course hot pan orange juice also
freshly squeezed is better now I have
found that red pepper flakes really vary
in their intensity so you might want to
just taste one if it burns your mouth
out use less than the recipe says honey
whole-grain mustard and then salt you
need a lot of salt with chicken
especially chicken on the bone it really
takes it in this looks like a lot but
it's just the right amount bay leaf
olive oil and pepper till your arm hurts
you want it to basically reduce by half
and what it gets really syrupy then I'm
gonna mix it onto the chicken and I'm
gonna add the rest of my ingredients I
have these blanched lemon slices and the
reason that I blanched them is that if
you just added regular lemon slices they
would be a little bit chewy after the
chicken roasted but if you blanch them
then they get tender and they're really
soft and lovely to bite into and then I
have some fresh thyme leaves here as
part of the Middle Eastern influence I
was talking about I have dates you can
also chop them up more finely if you
like and I also have carrots and carrots
are actually how I came up with this
dish in the first place I was thinking
what should I make for the Jewish
holidays and usually for the Jewish
holidays you make a dish called tzimmes
which is carrots and honey and often
dried fruit the idea is you want to
assure in a sweet new year so you want
it to be a little bit sweet and I
thought what if I add a chicken to that
dish and turned it into an entree and
onions now you just want to toss all of
this together so that everything gets
coated with the sauce
and you should just use your hands
because this is impossible so just get
in there my hands are very clean I just
watch them and then I'm gonna watch them
again I promise and so now you just want
to cover it and then stick it in the
fridge for as long as you have even 30
minutes is good 24 hours is best so this
goes on a sheet pan so I get lots of
surface area and the chicken and the
carrots will get beautifully brown as it
roasts so an important thing about
roasting this is if the white meat will
cook faster than a dark meat so you want
to remove it as it's finished cooking
then you take the dark meat out when
that's ready and you leave the carrots
in because the carrots will actually
take longer to get tender
than the chicken now I'm gonna pop it in
the oven so the white meat is done at
this point
cover them just to keep the chicken warm
while the dark meat cooks and now the
dark meat is finished I just want to
give your carrots a stir so they cook
evenly and then they're gonna need a few
more minutes in the oven to finish now
you just put the sauce right on top of
the chicken I'm gonna give this a very
fresh garnish to contrast with all these
roasted flavors so I have some scallions
pistachio nuts and then parsley or you
could use mint this dish is pretty
terrific for the Jewish holidays but you
know what it's great all year long
Oh
